page.title: 17Education
page.content: Education in the area is provided under two different Local Education Authorities. One is St. Helens Borough Council which is responsible for Bushey Lane Church of England Primary School. This school was originally set up and run by the Rainford Colliery Company and celebrated its centenary in 1977. The school is now in new premises next to the old school. At present the school has 3 teachers, a head teacher named Miss Garlic and 41 pupils. The other school is Holy Trinity Church of England School and is situated in Bickerstaffe. This school is under the control of Lancashire County Council. It has 70 pupils at the present time. When the children reach the age of 11 they have to travel outside the area to their secondary schools.
